resources.string: Curse of Brightwood
"Brightwood is cursed?"
It has been for three hundred years, if not longer. The plague of soullessness on Aeternum is stronger here.\n\nThe Lost are a far greater threat here than any Corruption - they dominate these lands.
"Can't anything be done?"

Perhaps. Herbalist Lau came here within the last decade, and she believes the land itself may be cursed.\n\nIf you can gather her soil samples from some of the northern towns, she can test her theory. It would be most appreciated.
Search the old farms in north Brightwood for evidence of what may have caused the land to become cursed. Talk to Herbalist Lau in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is complete.
Be wary of the Lost wandering around among those old farms. They can be quite dangerous in numbers.
Oh, hi there! Are you the one the Head Cleric sent out to collect soil samples from the northern townships?\n\nAh, perfect. Thank you! I'm Herbalist Lau, and you are?
"I'm {playerName}."
Yes, let's see - you found these bone fragments in the ground there?\n\nNot entirely surprising around this old territory, but these other items... I wonder.
Collect Soil Samples from {POITags}
Gather Soil Samples

string.comment: Undead Gravedigger, Eerily Glowing Fertilizer, Sleepy Sarmad
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Defeat {targetName} to collect {itemName}
Collect Soil Samples from {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from the Lost at {POITags}
Inquisitor's Legacy
"Why has it lasted so long?"

That's a history lesson for you. Three hundred years ago, all Aeternum was facing a plague of soullessness. \n\nThe Lost rising in unprecedented numbers, and the worst of it here in Brightwood. Course, I was but a lass then.
"But you remember it?"

Nah, I didn't arrive until later - the inquisitors were all gone by then, so I became a Justiciar instead.\n\nBut I'm as committed as the Inquisitors were to ending the Lost for once and all. Maybe you want to help?
"I'm {playerName} and yes, I'll help."

Perfect. First thing we need is the tools the Inquisitors had at their disposal.\n\nInquisitor Lucia was the bane of the soulless... until she lost her own. Destroy her and reclaim her tools. She'd want it this way.
Destroy the feared Inquisitor Lucia and recover her tools. Talk to Justiciar Farrell in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is complete.
Inquisitor Lucia's talent for purging the soulless made her particularly dangerous when she became Lost.\n\nI'd exercise extreme caution.
Look at this - the legendary Inquisitor Lucia is down and you've recovered the tools of her trade.\n\nThese implements will help us in our campaign, {playerName}. You've done well.
Search for Inquisitor Lucia at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} at {POITags}
Destroy {targetName}
Restoring the Light
"Are there more relics out there?"

Several, in fact. Head Cleric Pennyfather has been hesitant to go in search of them, but we know they're there.\n\nYou saw the old Cathedral, yes? The Inquisition - those were the glory years of Brightwood, to be sure.
"You want to restore the Inquisition?"

Not in name, but in effectiveness. Sacrist Johannes kept the Inquisition's relics.\n\nSearch outside the church in Brackwater to recover Johannes's books and the amulets worn by his Anointed followers. Godspeed, {playerName}.
Search Ballard's Manor and Dromgoole for the books of Sacrist Johannes and the amulets worn by his followers. Talk to Justiciar Farrell in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is complete.
The church in Brackwater is called Ballard's Curse now. You'll find the Sacrist's books there, and the soulless Lost who once followed him in the town nearby.
Aha! The Sacrist's books and those azoth-infused amulets.\n\nI must study Johannes's writing, but I believe with these, we'll be capable of battling the Lost like we haven't in three centuries!
Confront the Sacrist's followers in {POITags}
Defeat the Anointed for {itemName}s
Seek the Sacrist's Books in {POITags}
Search chests at {POITags} for {itemName}
Lost and Returned
"What does 'haunted' mean on Aeternum?"
Same as it does everywhere else - something from the past becomes a plague to the present.\n\nThe Inquisition from three hundred years ago - we still don't know what happened.
"No one knows how it ended?"

Head Cleric Pennyfather only remembers that the Inquisitors ultimately became Lost themselves.\n\nI have an idea, though. Search the Lost in the other townships for burial tokens. That might jar Pennyfather's memory.
Collect burial tokens from the Lost in various towns in Brightwood. Talk to Head Cleric Pennyfather in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is complete.
I know it's gross, but I suspect we'll learn something. \n\nBring the burial tokens from the Lost to Head Cleric Pennyfather.
It's good to see you again. Let's see, I'm forgetting your name at the moment…\n\nBut what's this? Burial tokens? From all those places? Oh, no…
"What's the significance of this?"

I was... young during the Inquisition, so I only heard rumors.\n\nThe Inquisitors buried the Lost - or anyone they thought was at danger of becoming Lost - an unthinkable fate to be stuck, buried, still conscious.
Collect Burial Tokens at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from the Lost at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName} at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName} at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName} at {POITags}
Held Below The Surface
"She's probably right."
I'm starting to agree. At the very least, this means Justiciar Farrell's obsession with the Inquisition's tactics is ill-advised.\n\nOf course, she seems to have little respect for me these days.
"I can talk to her."

That would be wise. Farrell's studying the Anointed, including Inquisitor Matthias who allegedly committed these terrible acts.\n\nSearch for him in north Brackwater and bring his relics to the Justiciar. Then tell her.
Confront Inquisitor Matthias, now among the Lost outside Brackwater, and bring his Medallion and Soul Candles to Justiciar Farrell in the Brightwood Settlement.
Be wary if you go near Brackwater.\n\nIf Brightwood is cursed and Inquisitor Matthias responsible, it will be dangerous there.
This medallion... it belonged to Inquisitor Matthias? Aye, this is another of the relics I've been seeking.\n\nOh, but it feels heavy, dark, laden with... suffering.
"The inquisitors did some dark things."
They did, didn't they? Indeed, holding this, I can feel the truth of that.\n\nPerhaps my plan to revive their tactics was naïve. I think so. Thank you for bringing this to me.
Confront the fallen Inquisitor Matthias in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
Collect Soul Candles from the Anointed in {POITags}
Collect {itemName}s from the Anointed
The New Threat
"No concerns about Corruption in Brightwood?"

Not to speak of, though there have been a few sightings, and some suspicions about the lumber mill.\n\nJusticiar Farrell said you've been helping her… any chance you can also check on the people at the lumber mill?
"Just make sure there's no Corruption?"

Well, let's hope everything's fine. If Corruption has spread there, then that's another matter.\n\nTry to figure out how it spread, and if possible, destroy the source of it. Let's hope that's not the case.
Visit Shervey's Lumber Mill and investigate any Corruption that has spread there. Talk to Justiciar Sobol in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is complete.
If Corruption has spread to the lumber mill, just make sure it's not going any further.

Oh, thank the heavens you've returned. No sooner had you departed then we heard the reports.\n\nThe Corruption had already taken over the lumber mill, but let me see - did you manage to learn anything else?
"That they're battling against the Lost."
Hmm. Yes, it seems the Corrupted are more worried about the Lost than they are about us.\n\nI don't know if that should be a relief or just further cause for concern. Good to know, however.
Search for the mysterious device
Investigate {POITags}
In {POITags}:
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Defeat {targetName} to collect {itemName}
Investigate {POITags}
Destroy {targetName} Corrupted at {POITags}
Secrets of the Earth
"We should feel sorry for the Lost?"
Of course. I have been here longer than these others, long enough that no one listens to old Bankole any more.\n\nI know things, though. I might even know how to bring relief to the soulless ones.
"Relief for the Lost?"
Indeed, for as long as I have seen the Lost suffer, the Angry Earth have witnessed it all along.\n\nThe Bronzeroot warriors have methods of battling the Lost. Face them and discover their secrets.
Defeat Bronzeroot warriors and search for the source of their ability to fight against the Lost. Talk to Embalmer Bankole in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is complete.
The Bronzeroot Warriors are a new expression of the Angry Earth, but they know the old ways.\n\nDefeat them and learn how it is that they so easily defeat the Lost.
These satchels... their scent... do you smell it? Moss Spores.\n\nIt makes sense, does it not? That which withers with half-death is susceptible to the energy of fresh life.
Investigate the Angry Earth at {POITags}
Defeat Bronzeroot Warriors for {itemName}s
Search chests at {POITags} for {itemName}
Earth will Provide
"Should I give her the satchels?"

Ah, but there is even a greater service you can perform.\n\nI believe this why the Bronzeroot adorn themselves as they do. Collect the full-grown samples from the area, and bring those to the Justiciar.
Defeat Bronzeroot warriors and collect any mossy growths in the area. Talk to Justiciar Farrell in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is complete.
I believe the secrets the Bronzeroot Warriors employ will aid us greatly in protecting ourselves against the Lost.

Ah, what's this? Moss from the Bronzeroot, eh? This is what gives them protection against the Lost?\n\nPerhaps the azoth in the water? Perfect, we will incorporate this into our armors, as well. You have my thanks.
Travel to {POITags} to acquire more potent protections
Collect {itemName} from chests in {POITags}
Gather {itemName} from Moss Puffballs
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName} at {POITags}
Dark Legacy
"What did he say?"
He said that while the Inquisition made matters worse in Brightwood, it was not the source of the curse.\n\nHe said that legacy goes back more than a thousand years.
"We should investigate this."

Indeed. Bankole hinted that the curse is 'in the bones' of the land, and then he left.\n\nI wonder - the ghouls at the old Sinanovic farm have been there for centuries - if you could collect their bones, we might learn more.
Defeat the Ghouls in Sinanovic Farm to collect bones. Talk to Head Cleric Pennyfather in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is done.
Go to the Sinanovic Farm to the south and collect the ghouls' bones. I worry what further horrors we might discover.
What did you find - let's see… oh dear, I think I'm going to be sick. You can see it too, can't you?\n\nThese ghouls' bones were broken and then reformed, perhaps dozens of times.
"What does it mean?"
It means that the early settlers here in Brightwood ground up the bodies of the Lost into pieces.\n\nThen they used those remains to fertilize their fields. No wonder the land itself is cursed.
Investigate {POITags} for the True Source of the Curse
Dig up {itemName}
Heart of Darkness (Elite)
"Why would they do such things?"

Azoth. Don't you see? By grinding up the bones of the Lost and perhaps even others, they sowed the earth with azoth.\n\nIt helped their crops, but at what cost? Think of the suffering it caused - of course the land is cursed.
"Is there anything we can do?"

The earliest humans here were governed from Brightwood Isle, by… a name of Archminister Havelock.\n\nThe isle is a bad place, but perhaps by destroying Havelock and studying his scrolls, we might earn some redemption for Brightwood.
Destroy Archminister Havelock on Brightwood Isle and collect his writings. Talk to Head Cleric Pennyfather in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is done.
Brightwood Isle is a source of terrible darkness in the center of Lake Genevieve. \n\nGo there if you dare to face Archminister Havelock, but I fear for your safety.

Strange, the moment you did the deed, I sensed it. I think we all did, though some might not have realized it.\n\nBut I do believe Havelock's fall may have restored some long-lost light to these lands.
"Is that everything then?"

It's never everything on Aeternum, is it? This is a drama without end.\n\nI will study Havelock's writing, though I can see it's mostly madness. No, not everything, but I think Havelock's legacy is finally gone.
Journey to {POITags} and Destroy Archminister Havelock
Collect {itemName} from chests at {POITags}
Destroy {targetName}
Defeat Alchemical Enemies and collect {itemName}s
Trouble in the Fen
Speak to Constable Kemal in Weaver's Fen to hear about some of the troubles they're facing with the Lost.
"Trouble with the Lost?"

That's what I heard. There were a few refugees that passed through recently.\n\nThey said there was trouble with the Lost and some illness that people in the Fen are contracting, as well. Be safe if you head out that way.
Whatever's happening in Weaver's Fen, I hope it stays there.\n\nBrightwood has seen it's share of dark times. We deserve a break… one of these days.
Are you the one who's just arrived from Brightwood, then?\n\nYes, yes. I heard things have improved a little over there. Suppose that's a good thing.
Reaper's Locus (Expedition)
Defeat the Starstone Reaper and Collect the Reaper's Locus. Talk to Herbalist Lau in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is done.
"Like what exactly?"

We are both high achievers, at the top of our respective fields, mine being science, yours being… battle.\n\nIn fact, I wonder if you might partner with me to acquire an item of great scientific value?
"I would do the footwork?"

Exactly, and you would be rewarded. But it requires entering the Shattered Obelisk, so you'll need friends.\n\nThere is a Reaper, you'll see his sickles… he once culled creatures to collect their azoth.
"That's appalling."
Like so much else here, it offends the modern sensibilities.\n\nBut this Reaper would've used some kind of Locus to collect azoth - that's what I need. Bring me the Locus, and we'll both profit.
Before you go marching into the Shattered Obelisk, I'd suggest finding some friends.\n\nWho knows what you'll find there? I just need the Reaper's Locus.
Oh, it's about time. You're such a talent, I frankly expected you to return much sooner.\n\nBut don't get me wrong - I'm very grateful. I'll take the Locus, and you can have this.
Delve into {POITags} to collect the Starstone Reaper's Locus
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Belly of the Corrupted
Sabotage the food supply chain for the Corrupted at Reida's Burrow. Talk to Ranger Shui Tijong in Brightwood when the task is done.
"We can't allow that."
My thoughts exactly - we can warn the settlement later. We must strike hard and fast.\n\nI have been watching the Corrupted forces' movements since they arrived.
"Have you seen any patterns?"

Yes. They seized this area to use it as a critical part of their supply chain for food and weapons.\n\nAn army marches on its belly, so let's strike their food supplies first, and destroy their hunters.
If we destroy the hunters and claim all their ration, the Corrupted forces' supply lines will be in dire straits.
Well done, friend. With their rations stolen and their hunters compromised, the Corrupted will be hungry.\n\nHungry soldiers are desparate soldiers and desparate soldiers are sloppy.
Sabotage the Corrupted Supply Chain at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Infernal Armaments
Assault the Corrupted Forces' weapon-making operations at the Iron Fields. Talk to Ranger Shui Tijong in Brightwood when the task is complete.
"That seems to work."
The main thrust of the Corrupted operations here is the mission to supply their forces with armaments.\n\nThey have a start-to-finish process under way, mining the ore and forging the weapons.
"Where are they most vulnerable?"
The core of the operation is here in the mines, but it is well-defended.\n\nI suggest you target the Iron Fields to the north; that is where they are stockpiling weapons. Good luck.
The Iron Fields is where the Corrupted forces' weaponmaking operations is most vulnerable.\n\nStrike there and they will not soon recover.
Did you manage to get the weapons? Excellent, excellent. Let me see...\n\nThese are… very well-made weapons for the Corrupted. How… oh no, it can't be! Master Smith McCoy?
Steal Corrupted Weapons from {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}
Steal {itemName} from chests in {POITags}
Blacksmith Betrayer
Destroy Master Smith McCoy who's running Corlew's Mining Operations, and reclaim McCoy's Weapon Designs. Talk to Ranger Shui Tijong in Brightwood when the task is done.
"Do you know where he is?"
There can be no doubt - McCoy is the one leading this operation in Corlew's Mine.\n\nI fear with him in charge, our efforts will prove to have been only a minor setback for the Corrupted.
"Then let's take out McCoy."

A direct assault on Corlew's mine? You are a brave soul, my friend, though perhaps a little insane.\n\nVery well, then. Take out Master Smith McCoy and make sure to reclaim any of his designs. Be careful.
Though I worry about what resistance you meet fighting your way in, I have to admit, taking out Master Smith McCoy quickly does seem wise.
Is McCoy down then? Ah, and his designs? Excellent! This will disrupt the Corrupted's supply chain.\n\nI salute your courage, Warrior, and your valor. There are few who could do what you have done.
Sabotage Master Smith McCoy's Operation at {POITags}
Reclaim {itemName} from chests in {POITags}
Destroy {targetName} to disrupt the Corrupted's weapon supply
Scout Northern Greyvale for a waterfall
Scout South of Greyvale for a waterfall
Scout North of Lake Genevieve for a waterfall
Location Scout
Search for vibrant waterfalls for Wolcott to paint and place an easel at each one. Talk to Painter Wolcott in Brightwood when the task is done.
"You don’t have time?"

Sadly, I don’t have time to both find all the beautiful locations and paint them. Searching cannot be rushed, and it takes me so long to get my paints arranged just how I like them. \n\nBut perhaps you could help!
"What do you mean?

You could go and find the most beautiful locations for me to paint. \n\nYou will save me a lot of time if you set up an easel at each waterfall you find, then come back and tell me about them. It will be perfect!
I need some inspiration, something that jumps out of the landscape and onto a canvas! \n\nGo on, I'm counting on you to find it!
Marvelous! The rushing water, the way the sunlight glints through the trees. Yes, yes! I can work with this.
"What will you do now?"
Now that you’ve marked these locations in my map, I have to get my paints in order. \n\nIt wouldn't do to get all ready to start, only to be missing the correct shade of blue.
Scout Southern Greyvale for a waterfall
Scout Northern Greyvale for a waterfall
Scout Western Greyvale for a waterfall
Eye for Reflection
Search for dynamic waterfalls for Wolcott to paint and place an easel at each one. Talk to Painter Wolcott in Brightwood when the task is done.
"The power?"
How dynamic it makes an image. How alive you feel when seeing it. How it moves, even when still. \n\nI can already tell these waterfalls will be best sellers. I’m going to need more locations!
"More waterfalls?"
Yes! There are so many located in Greyvale. It is a painter’s paradise. \n\nI could use your discerning eye to find more waterfalls for my paintings.
You were such help before that I need your help again. \n\nSearch for energetic waterfalls I can use as reference.
These are magnificent! Thank you for marking their locations on my map. I can only hope my waterfall paintings are able to compete with what is already out there.
"What do you mean?"
I’m not the only landscape painter on Aeternum. Painter Cole is already famous for her ‘Bear in Meadow’ and ‘Mountain Dawn’ paintings which are popular in the settlements.
Scout Central Greyvale for a lake
Scout Northern Greyvale for a lake
Scout Eastern Greyvale for a lake
Wolcott's Masterpiece
Search for picturesque lakes for Wolcott to paint and place an easel at each one. Talk to Painter Wolcott in Brightwood when the task is done.
"There are some nice lakes around here."
I’ve decided that my next collection of paintings will be of the local lakes. \n\nSomething restful to the eye, and calming to the soul. They are certain to be popular!
"What about the waterfalls?"
I’ll paint them too! I need to paint all of them in order to keep up with that overachiever Cole. \n\nPlease find three inspiring lakes where you can place my easel.
The waterfalls you found before were just lovely. \n\nNow I need three lakes for my next paintings!

Superb! The locations you have chosen fit perfectly within the landscape, like a slice of sky fallen to the ground. \n\nPainting these lakes will be a joy. And Cole hasn’t painted anything like them yet!
"She hasn’t?"
No, I will be the first to paint these lakes! Soon my name will be known as the painter of lakes and waterfalls. \n\nThank you for marking these in my map. I can’t wait to get to work!
A Simple Tea
Fight the Bronzeroot Dryads of the Green Defile for the Undefiled Tea Leaves and bring them back to Naturalist Khunbish in Brightwood.
"What do you need?"
The soullessness of the Lost has ravaged Brightwood for centuries. Some say the land is cursed.\n\nBut the Angry Earth thrive down there, despite all the death around them.
"What's their secret?"

The Angry Earth have many secrets, but the one I seek to know is related to a tea they drink.\n\nThe Bronzeroot of the Defile - they carry special tea leaves. Get some for me, and I will be in your debt.
The Bronzeroot of the Green Defile carry these special tea leaves.\n\nCollect some for me, and I will reward you.
Ah, do you have them, then? Yes, these leaves are perfect!\n\nThe tea I can brew from these leaves, well, I am not even sure of all of its properties.
Venture into the {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Dryads to collect {itemName}
Sweet Secrets
Find Lush Sugarsap from the Trees in Lush Hideaway and bring them back to Naturalist Khunbish in Brightwood so that she can drink the tea she's brewing.
"A little honey should do the trick."
No, I have sworn not to partake in the sweet product of the Apoidea.\n\nThe trees from the south caverns will yield Lush Sugarsap, but the Angry Earth there are very protective.
"You want me to go for you?"

Yes, if you are willing to venture into the Lush Hideaway and collect some Lush Sugarsap, I will double your reward.\n\nTry to harm as few of the Angry Earth as possible - they act only from instinct.
It is not the Wyrdwood trees I speak of but the regular trees in the cavern that will yield the Lush Sugarsap.\n\nThank you for your help.
There! Please tell me you were able to get the Lush Sugarsap! Yes, this will do!\n\nNow, at least I will be able to drink this tea, assuming I have what I need to brew it.
Collect Lush Sugarsap in {POITags}
Harvest {itemName} from the Young Trees in {POITags}
Verdant Adelphia
Collect Adelphian Tubers from the Verdant Cavern and bring them to Naturalist Khunbish in Brightwood so she can finally make her tea.
"Let me guess - you need something else?"
I do, though I fear I have imposed on you enough, traveler. \n\nIf the Angry Earth weren't so cruel, I would not be in such a position. They hoard their secrets even from their allies.
"Are you considered an ally?"
There are some few of us on Aeternum who have enjoyed the Angry Earth's trust, though I lost their favor many years ago.\n\nSince then, I have spent every moment hoping to regain it.
"Is that what this tea is for?"
Yes. I suppose there is no harm in telling you the truth. To complete the tea I need Adelphian Tubers.\n\nThey are carried by the Shamans in the Verdant Cavern. Get them, and I will be redeemed.
None of this would be necessary if they would just allow me back into the fold. This tea, and those Adelphian Tubers, are now the only way.
Did you defeat the Shamans? Aha! The tubers! This is the last ingredient!\n\nNow, I can finally brew the magical tea which will redeem me to the Angry Earth.
Collect Adelphian Tubers in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName} in the {POITags}
Azoth Tree Achene (Elite)
Defeat the Angry Earth Leader Ceran at the Azoth Tree and collect his Achene. Talk to Naturalist Khunbish in Brightwood when the task is done.
"Go ahead then. I'm listening."
It was the leader of the Angry Earth in this region who cast me out - a Dryad Archer named Ceran.\n\nEven with the tea you have give me, he might just cast me out again.
"You want me to fight him?"
Yes, though to be honest, I suspect even you will have difficulty.\n\nIf you will destroy him and bring me his Achene, I will reward you with finery.
Destroy Ceran and bring me his Achene, and then, I will be able to walk among the Angry Earth again.
Ceran is gone. I can sense it. You have done well, more than you know - you have restored the true order here.\n\nI am sorry I could not tell you the whole truth before.
"What is the whole truth?"
The truth is that I was guardian of the Azoth Tree until Ceran drove me away.\n\nWith this tea, I can assume my proper form, and with Ceran gone, I can assume my proper place. Thank you, human.
Defeat the Angry Earth Leader at the {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
Bear Co-Habitation
Help Hunter Hutchison in Brightwood get vengeance against some savage bears in Greyvale that destroyed his family.
"You don't live there any more?"
No. They don't want me. They've made that painfully clear.\n\nMy wife Susan and I lived among them for decades, in perfect harmony. Until a few months ago.
"What happened?"

One day they turned on us, tore us both apart and feasted on our flesh. Susan… she became Lost after that.\n\nDon't know why I'm still here, except for revenge. In fact, destroy a few of the beasts for me, and I'll reward you.
I still can't get over it. Out of nowhere, they just turned on us.\n\nHelp me get my vengeance, and I'll be in your debt.
I heard those bastards snarling and growling all the way down here.\n\nWe're only giving them what they deserve.
Destroy {targetName} in {POITags}
Papa Bear (Elite)
Hunter Hutchison has asked you to destroy Gren, the massive bear who killed his wife, and reclaim his wife's ring. Bring the ring back to Hunter Hutchinson in Brightwood.
"Any family anywhere?"
Nah, Susan and these bears are the only real family I ever had.\n\nLiving out there, foraging for honey, hibernating… it's the only life I know, the only place I feel at home.
"Maybe you should stay then."

Angry as I am, it's the only thing that feels right. I guess I could try.\n\nIt was the patriarch, Gren, that turned on us. If you can destroy Gren and recover Susan's ring, I might have a chance. Be careful, though.
It was that monster Gren that ate my sweet wife.\n\nDestroy him, and then I can return to the family, those I have left.

It's done then? That monstrosity of a bear gone? You're brave soul, and a hardy one too.\n\nAll right, I'll work up the nerve and go back home. If they turn on me again, I don't know. Guess I'll end up like Susan.
Track down the Alpha Bear at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
Memories of Another Life
Megara Pantazis lived in the Walsham area many decades ago. She's asked you to retrieve her mementos from the town and return them to her in Brightwood so she can relive her past.
"What happened?"

The town of Walsham fell to the Lost… it's been more years than I can count, now.\n\nBelieve it or not, the wedding was on this very spot - a moment I never want to forget. He was the love of my life, you know.
"He's become a Lost now?"

Yes, he fell to despair. I had too much pride for that - I picked up and started over, many times since.\n\nNow, I just want those memories. If you venture into town; I'd love you to recover some of my old keepsakes.
Those years in Walsham were the best I had.\n\nIf you could recover those Mementos, it would mean a lot.
Well, look at these! You found all my old mementos.\n\nIt's sad, isn’t it? Or it should be. But for some reason, it's only reminding me of all the good times we had.
Search for Megara's Mementos in {POITags}
Search for {itemName} in chests in {POITags}
Home No More

Megara Pantazis has decided she wants to join the love of her life as a Lost. She's asked you to find her journal in Marcel's Hamlet and bring it to her in Brightwood so that she might read it and despair.
"What are you saying?"
What I'm saying is that I've spent all these years trying to keep my chin up, rallying for life.\n\nMeanwhile, the love of my life is Lost, and soon, even forgotten. I've decided I want to join him.
"And how will you manage that?"

By demoralizing myself. I had hoped these mementos would do the trick, but apparently not.\n\nIf you're willing, I left an old journal in our home in Marcel's Hamlet. Those were hard times. The journal should do the trick.
I kept the journal for years and years, when our love was forbidden, and then after.\n\nThe journal will get me there - I feel certain.

Is that it? Oh good gods, look at that old thing. Tattered and weathered, but still in one piece.\n\nLet me read it, this should bring back all that despair I felt then. This is the way I'll rejoin my love.
Search for Megara's Journal at {POITags}
Search for {itemName} In chests in {POITags}
Til Death do us Part (Elite)

Megara Pantazis has admitted the love of her life was actually Pastor Walsham. She's asked you be sure nothing of his human nature remains before she joins him as a Lost. Talk to her in Brightwood when the task is complete.
"When what truth came out?"
The truth about my true love. I didn't tell you the whole story before.\n\nThe wedding that took place here, it wasn't where I married my true love, it was where I met him.
"Whose wedding was it?"
Oh, it was mine, but that man was as dull as dirt - Aulus - he came from the Legion with me.\n\nPastor Walsham was the one who married us - he's the one who became the love of my life.
"And you want to join him as a Lost?"

Precisely, but I'm afraid this journal isn't doing the trick either.\n\nLet's try this - go and find my love, my true love, Pastor Walsham. Defeat him and bring me something of his. That should break me.
My love was a formidable man in life. I suspect he will be difficult to defeat. Do take care.
Did you see him? Did he seem miserable as a Lost, or actually at peace?\n\nOh, I do so want to join him. What did you find, though? What's this?
"A letter addressed to you."

Let me see then.. Oh, he says he couldn't bear it. He chose to become Lost to avoid facing me.\n\nApparently, he was going to end it... the shame, and so forth. The coward. Well, I think you've convinced me to live. Thank you.
Confront Pastor Walsham at the Walsham Congregation
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
Marauder Advancement: Gladiator
Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Gladiator and then complete the Trial of the Gladiator Quest from the Faction Representative in Cutlass Keys.
Complete missions from the Faction Board, then report to the local Magistrate
Earn Faction Reputation to face the Trial for your next Rank
Travel to Cutlass Keys and complete the Trial of the Gladiator\n(Recommended Level: 25)
Marauder Advancement: Ravager
Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Ravager and then complete the Trial of the Ravager Quest from the Faction Representative in Weaver's Fen.
Travel to Weaver's Fen and complete the Trial of the Ravager\n(Recommended Level: 35)
Marauder Advancement: Destroyer
Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Destroyer and then complete the Trial of the Destroyer Quest from the Faction Representative in Restless Shore.
Travel to Restless Shore and complete the Trial of the Destroyer\n(Recommended Level: 49)
Marauder Advancement: Commander
Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Commander and then complete the Trial of the Commander Quest from the Faction Representative in Ebonscale Reach.
Travel to Ebonscale Reach and complete the Trial of the Commander\n(Recommended Level: 60)
Trial of the Gladiator
Defeat the Lost Pirate Hamidou to prove you're worthy to advance to the rank of Gladiator. Talk to Ravager Silas in Cutlass Keys when the task is complete.
"Can't be too hard. You made it."
Oh, a really smart tongue on this one. It's a shame I don't have time to make you back it up.\n\nThis challenge will be too much anyhow, I'd bet my career you'll fail.
"Just tell me what I have to do."
Seems you're in a hurry to experience a painful death. Fine.\n\nThe legendary warrior Hamidou - now a Lost Pirate - you'll have to defeat him in combat… you don't have a chance.
Smart. You should put off facing Hamidou for as long as possible.\n\nMaybe even forever.
You defeated Hamidou? You? You… weasel. Just cost me a pile of azoth on that bet.\n\nVery well, you're a Gladiator. Now, get on your way before I smash your face.
Defeat Lost Pirate Hamidou in {POITags} to earn the rank of Gladiator
Defeat {targetName}
Trial of the Ravager
Defeat enemies across Weaver's Fen to advance to the rank of Ravager. Talk to Commander Bergeron in Weaver's Fen when the task is complete.
"Yes, I'm looking forward to it."
Be wary of what you wish for, young warrior. This test will have you wading through swampwater, and through blood.\n\nTravel the Fen and face the enemies it throws at you. I will await you here.
Face whatever challenges the Fen sends your way, and then you will be a Ravager.
Ah, the victor returns. Success in battle feeds the soul like nothing else, does it not?\n\nI welcome you to the ranks of the Ravagers, {playerName}. Though I fear Ravager Silas will not be pleased.
"Why won't Silas be pleased?"
She made it very well known throughout the ranks that she did not think you worthy of further advancement.\n\nBe proud, for you have certainly proven her wrong.
In Fenton Hamlet:
In Swampwater Fishery:
In Angler's Doom:
Cut down {targetName} Lost
Defeat {targetName} Lost
Eliminate {targetName} Lost
Trial of the Destroyer
Destroy enemies from each region of Mourningdale to prove you're worthy to advance to the rank of Destroyer. Talk to Destroyer Garcia in Restless Shores when the task is complete.
"Why was it a scandal?"
Because you apparently committed some offense against Ravager Silas. She does not take things lightly.\n\nBut come, are you prepared to face the trial to advance your rank?
"I am. What must I do?"
You must prove yourself as an ultimate warrior, capable of facing any challenge.\n\nYou will have to defeat many enemies in Mourningdale, but you will win great glory!
I have great faith in you, my friend. Face the enemies you must, and prove yourself an ultimate warrior.
Aha! Victory! You join the upper ranks of the Marauders now, {playerName}.\n\nIt is an esteemed position. And you have exceeded Ravager Silas's rank. She will be furious.
"That's her problem."

It certainly should be. She is known for her short temper, however. Let's hope she doesn't even hear of this.\n\nBut no more talk of Silas, eh? Instead, I celebrate your ascension. Excelsior, my fellow warrior!
In Cutthroat's Creed:
In Mourning Bridge:
In Foulroot:
Cut down {targetName} Ancients
Defeat {targetName} Lost
Eliminate {targetName} Corrupted
Trial of the Commander
Defeat Corrupted Ravager Silas to prove you're worthy to advance to the rank of Commander. Talk to Commander Hartford in Ebonscale when the task is complete.
"I am ready. What do I do?"
Unfortunately, your trial is going to have to be rather unique.\n\nAs you may recall, Ravager Silas developed quite a rivalry with you. Her rage drove her to become Corrupted.
"Silas is Corrupted?"

Indeed. Seething, she came here to challenge you to a duel, to block your advancement. The red was already in her eyes.\n\nYour trial is to honor that duel, destroy the thing that Ravager Silas has become.
There is a sad irony to the way this thing has unfolded.\n\nRavager Silas must be destroyed.
I know that can't have been pleasant. We must honor the memory of what Silas aspired to, rather than what she became.\n\nOn a much brighter note, I am proud to bestow on you the title of 'Commander'.
Defeat the Corrupted Ravager Silas in {POITags} to earn the rank of Commander
Defeat {targetName}
Syndicate Advancement: Scrivener
Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Scrivener and then complete the Trial of the Scrivener Quest from the Faction Representative in Brightwood.
Complete missions from the Faction Board, then report to the local Magistrate
Earn Faction Reputation to face the Trial for your next Rank
Travel to Brightwood and complete the Trial of the Scrivener\n(Recommended Level: 25)
Syndicate Advancement: Chronicler
Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Chronicler and then complete the Trial of the ChroniclerQuest from the Faction Representative in Weaver's Fen.
Travel to Weaver's Fen and complete the Trial of the Chronicler\n(Recommended Level: 35)
Syndicate Advancement: Cabalist
Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Cabalist and then complete the Trial of the Cabalist Quest from the Faction Representative in Mourningdale.
Travel to Mourningdale and complete the Trial of the Cabalist\n(Recommended Level: 49)
Syndicate Advancement: Alchemist
Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Alchemist and then complete the Trial of the Alchemist Quest from the Faction Representative in Reekwater.
Travel to Reekwater and complete the Trial of the Alchemist\n(Recommended Level: 60)
Trial of the Scrivener
Defeat Lost Gheist Malikor and use the Psychokinetic Absorber to capture any soul remnants to earn the rank of Scrivener. Talk to Scrivener Krockes in Brightwood when the task is complete.
"I am. What must I do?"
You have arrived at the perfect moment, for I am ready to test my new Psychokinetic Absorber.\n\nDid you know that some of the Lost still have traces of their souls?
"Are you sure about that?"
Yes, we just need a fresh Lost to prove it. Find Gheist Malikor - he was quite formidable in life, so be careful.\n\nUse the Psychokinetic Absorber and strike down Malikor. You'll see!
Have you found Malikor yet? He's somewhere out there.\n\nUse the Absorber and bring back the traces of his soul!
Ah, at last! Yes, yes, you see? There are traces of Malikor's soul in here! This changes EVERYTHING!\n\nYou have done well, and I am pleased to promote you to Scrivener! Yes, yes. Now I must work!
Capture Soul Traces from Lost Gheist Malikor at {POITags} to Earn Rank of Scrivener
Place the Psychokinetic Absorber
Eliminate {targetName}
Collect the Psychokinetic Absorber
Trial of the Chronicler
Gather specimens from the various Lost in Weaver's Fen and return to Alchemist Rubis in Weaver's Fen to earn the rank of Chronicler.
"Yes. Will you administer my trial?"
Indeed. Alchemist Krockes had wanted to be here for this, but I see no reason to delay.\n\nGather me specimens from the various Lost here in the Fen, and I'll promote you to 'Chronicler'.
Gather the specimens for our work here in the Fen, and then I will see you advanced in rank.
Really? You got all the specimens? And rather quickly too, I think.\n\nPerhaps this will aid in my research to the same extent your previous work helped Krockes. That would be a boon.
"I hope it does."
It's probably folly for me to aspire to follow in Krockes's footsteps, but we'll see.\n\nEither way, you have earned your new rank. Congratulations, Chronicler {playerName}.
Harvest {itemName} from {targetName} Lost
Trial of the Cabalist
Place Psychokinetic Absorbers at strategic points in Mourningdale to earn the rank of Cabalist. Talk to Cabalist Crawford in Mourningdale when the task is done.
"Yes, what is the trial?"
For you, we have arranged for an extension of your previous work with souls.\n\nYou have used a Psychokinetic Absorber before - you practically made them famous!
"And what of Krockes?"

Krockes is too busy and will come soon, but I'm thrilled to have you.\n\nWe need to place Psychokinetic Absorbers at strategic points around Mourningdale. It will be… difficult, but such is the price of science!
Those Psychokinetic Absorbers won't place themselves.\n\nThe sooner, the better. Mores collected that way.

Perfect! Perfect! You have accomplished quite a feat, and I suspect there will be quite a yield when Krockes arrives.\n\nYes, you deserve the title of Cabalist. You are an incredible asset to the Syndicate.
Place Psychokinetic Absorbers in:
Presage Pier
Cutthroat's Creed
Pueblo Culto Nuñez
Sorrowsilt Ridge
Trial of the Alchemist

Defeat Alchemist Krockes and absorb his soul into the Psychokinetic Absorber and then take it to the Dryads in Reekwater to destroy it to earn the rank of Alchemist. Talk to Alchemist Santos in Reekwater when the task is done.
"How did it happen?"

The way it always does with the undisciplined, too enamored of his research and his reputation.\n\nKrockes was simply not strong-minded enough, unlike you. You are ready to face your final trial, are you not?
"I am. What must I do?"
You must learn the final lesson - to clean up the messes you've made.\n\nKrockes is not only Lost, he's harnessing soul power. He must be destroyed. Immediately. Don't fumble right before the finish.
When you find Krockes, don't hesitate. I suspect he has become quite… volatile.
Then the deed is done? Krockes is no more. Well done!\n\nThe integrity of our research must be preserved. You have earned the disctinction and rank of Alchemist. Congratulations!
Use Psychokinetic Absorber on Alchemist Krockes in {POITags}
Place the Psychokinetic Absorber
Defeat {targetName}
Collect the Psychokinetic Absorber
Destroy the Psychokinetic Absorber with the aid of the Dryads

Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Templar and then complete the Trial of the Templar Quest from the Faction Representative in Brightwood.
Complete missions from the Faction Board, then report to the local Magistrate
Earn Faction Reputation to face the Trial for your next Rank
Travel to Brightwood and complete the Trial of the Templar\n(Recommended Level: 25)
Covenant Advancement: Excubitor
Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Excubitor and then complete the Trial of the Excubitor Quest from the Faction Representative in Weaver's Fen.
Travel to Weaver's Fen and complete the Trial of the Excubitor\n(Recommended Level: 35)
Covenant Advancement: Lumen
Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Lumen and then complete the Trial of the Lumen Quest from the Faction Representative in Great Cleave.
Travel to Great Cleave and complete the Trial of the Lumen\n(Recommended Level: 49)
Covenant Advancement: Adjudicator
Earn enough Faction Reputation to qualify for the rank of Adjudicator and then complete the Trial of the Adjudicator Quest from the Faction Representative in Shattered Mountain.
Travel to Shattered Mountain and complete the Trial of the Adjudicator\n(Recommended Level: 60)
Trial of the Templar
Track down the missing Covenant Initiate Bremen Luca and attempt to discover what happened to him to advance to the rank of Templar. Talk to Templar Roose in Brightwood when the task is complete.
"I am ready. What do I do?"
One of our number - an Initiate like yourself - has become enamored of some… unorthodox ideas.\n\nHe has attracted a following, and they all must be brought back into the fold.
"What kind of ideas?"
The kind unworthy of sharing. The Initiate is an apostate now, Bremen Luca, and he is here in Brightwood.\n\nFor your trial, find him and bring him back, whatever is required to do so.
Find the Apostate and bring him back here.\n\nWe will purge these ideas from his mind, one way or another.
Ah, you have bad news… unfortunately, this is the fate awaiting any of us who stray from the path.\n\nIt was a mercy that you put him down. Did you find anything else?
"These journal pages."
Excellent. I will take those and send them to Adjudicator Maras.\n\nYou have done well today and earned your promotion, Templar. May the Spark light your path!
Track down Covenant Initiate Luca in {POITags} to Earn Rank of Templar
Purge {targetName}
Recover Apostate Luca's journal
Trial of the Excubitor
Put to rest some of those who've fallen in Weaver's Fen to advance to the rank of Excubitor. Talk to Adjudicator Sheng in Weaver's Fen when the task is complete.
"Only if it helps me be of greater service."
I have no doubt that it will. I sense that you are not meant to remain a Templar forever.\n\nI heard about that tragic business with the Apostate, Bremen Luca.
"It was unfortunate."
Yes, let us make sure your trial here is less… controversial.\n\nYou must simply put down some of those who've fallen here in the Fen. Then, you shall be Excubitor.
Travel the Fen and put down those who have fallen. That will earn you the rank of Excubitor.
It's a somber business, the campaign we are engaged in here in the Fen.\n\nYou have done more than your part. Congratulations on your advancement, Excubitor {playerName}.
Cut down {targetName} Lost
Defeat {targetName} Lost
Eliminate {targetName} Lost
Trial of the Lumen
Recover Prayer Beads from Corrupted Templars to earn the rank of Lumen. Talk to Excubitor Luca in Great Cleave when the task is done.
"Yes, I am prepared."
It seems you do not recognize my name, but I am Livia Luca.\n\nThe alleged apostate you tracked down in Brightwood was my only son.
"I am sorry for your loss."

Oh, you will make it up to me. You see, it was Adjudicator Maras who failed him, facilitated his fall, others too.\n\nSeveral Templars have fallen to Corruption here. For your trial, collect their Prayer Beads as proof.
I am the one who gets to determine your trial.\n\nBring me the prayer beads if you wish to advance in rank.
Let's see what you found. Yes, you see? Covenant Prayer Beads on the Corrupted.\n\nHow many must fall before Adjudicator Maras is exposed? Spark be with us - this ends here!
"What about my trial?"
Oh yes, that. My son would've been facing this same trial about now, you realize?\n\nBut you have served his memory well and earned your rank. Congratulations, Lumen!
Recover Prayer Beads from:
{POITags}
Trial of the Adjudicator
Destroy the Corrupted Excubitor Luca to earn the rank of Adjudicator. Talk to Adjudicator Maras in Shattered Mountain when the task is complete.
"I'm ready. What is the trial?"
Sometimes the darkest shadow lies within, my friend. Such was the case with Livia Luca.\n\nHer obsession with her son's legacy and her paranoia caused her to become Corrupted.
"And I must face her?"
Yes, the path to the purest light requires we purge the demons from our past.\n\nDestroy the Corrupted Excubitor and you will be made an Adjudicator.
The light guides our path, and right now, for you, it shines on Excubitor Luca. \n\nShe must be destroyed.

Then it is done? Spark light her way into a more peaceful place.\n\nWe have purged the Corruption from our ranks. Congratulations, I am proud to pronounce you as an Adjudicator. You are one of us, now.
Descend into {POITags} and confront Excubitor Luca to Earn the Rank of Adjudicator.
Eliminate {targetName}
Battle's Embrace
Recover the patterns and components needed to craft the Battle's Embrace Armor. Talk to Justiciar Sobol in Brightwood when the task is complete.
"Nothing worth doing is easy."
True, true. But I've heard of something that could help against the troubles.\n\nLegendary armor that makes the wearer into a veritable fortress!
"What is it?"
Battle's Embrace. It was once worn by a powerful commander, who marched against the Corrupted and beat them back to Shattered Mountain.\n\nBut then the commander, and the armor, vanish from the tale.
"No one knows where it is?"

No, the legends are hazy on what happened after the commander reached Shattered Mountain.\n\nAll that is left are the patterns used to make the armor. With these, and some materials, the armor could be reforged.
Keep alert for any of the materials needed to craft Battle's Embrace.\n\nWearing that armor is sure to inspire an entire generation of new warriors to fight against the Corrupted.
Do my eyes deceive me? You found all the materials to craft Battle's Embrace?\n\nYes, yes! To think, I get to see this legendary armor in action!
"Does it look as the legends say?"
Yes! It's everything I hoped! May it hold you in its embrace, protecting you from the battles that surely lie ahead.\n\nI'll have quite the tale to share tonight - Battle's Embrace has returned!
Complete Quest: Best Foot Forward
Complete Quest: Embrace the Fight

Executioner

Acquire Bucaneer's Plank from Stone Skull Fort, Hangman's Binding from Wayward Mounds, Blade of the Brutes from Plundering Shark, and the Infernal Coagulant from Grus to craft the infamous Axe, "Executioner." Talk to Head Cleric Pennyfather in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is complete.
"I'd be interested in that."

Ah, yes. I'm interested too… wait, what were we talking about? Oh yes - the Executioner.\n\nI'll give you a list of the elements required to reforge it. They might be a challenge to find, but I think it's worth it.
Oh! It's… your name is still eluding me, but I remember something about… oh yes, the axe, Executioner.\n\nGood luck finding everything you'll need.
Wait a minute… this is… you found everything needed to reforge Executioner?\n\nImpressive, very impressive. That is a very effective weapon if used… properly. Wield it well.
Hope Manifest

Acquire Mender's Cloth from Seele's Stake, Soothsayer's Salve from Catara Falls, Mercy's Breath from Eridanus, and the Hope Catalyst from Vela to craft the legendary Life Staff, "Hope Manifest." Talk to Embalmer Bankole in Brightwood when the task is complete.
"Where would I find this staff?"
Oh, you would not find such a thing, not for many centuries now. But I can show you to remake it.\n\nTake this list of the elements required, and then you can make the staff, "Hope Manifest."
You seek the elements of the staff, still?\n\nYou will find them, if you keep trying.
There is the new light of Brightwood, and you found everything you needed, yes?\n\nWith that staff in hand, you are the very thing, "Hope Manifest." Brightness will follow, wherever you go.
Collect items used to craft the Executioner
Collect items used to craft the Executioner
Collect items used to craft the Executioner
Collect items then craft the Executioner
The most treacherous of pirates only know one love: the sea's embrace.
Those bound to their fates in a gallows cannot escape them. Only you can deliver them.
The most brutal of us must give away their mercy, for they have none to show their foes.
Even the hottest blood running through veins oft still into fetid darkness.
Collect items used to craft Hope Manifest

Healing lies in the cloth of the mender, who dresses wounds carefully like an aegis.
Healing lies in the salve of the sooth sayer, a calming touch to numb pain.
Healing lies in the Breath of Mercy, a gift from the Fates who continue to weave.
Healing lies in hope, the hope to live, and those who catalyze that hope.
